data.Sentence_cn: 课文11  如何安度晚年
data.Sentence: --- Lesson 11 How to grow old

data.Sentence_cn: 作者认为，随着年龄的增长，克服死亡恐惧的最好方法是什么?
data.Sentence: What, according to the author, is the best way to overcome the fear of death as you get older?

data.Sentence_cn: 有些老年人因为怕死而感到烦恼。
data.Sentence: Some old people are oppressed by the fear of death.

data.Sentence_cn: 青年人有这种感觉是情有可原的。
data.Sentence: In the young there is a justification for this feeling.

data.Sentence_cn: 可以理解有理由害怕自己会死在战场上的年轻人，
data.Sentence: Young men who have reason to fear that they will be killed in battle

data.Sentence_cn: 会感到痛苦，
data.Sentence: may justifiably feel bitter in the thought

data.Sentence_cn: 在想到自己被剥夺了生活所能给予的最美好的东西时。
data.Sentence: that they have been cheated of the best things that life has to offer.

data.Sentence_cn: 可是老年人已经饱尝了人间的甘苦，
data.Sentence: But in an old man who has known human joys and sorrows,

data.Sentence_cn: 一切能做的都做了，
data.Sentence: and has achieved whatever work it was in him to do,

data.Sentence_cn: 如果怕死，就有点儿可怜又可鄙。
data.Sentence: the fear of death is somewhat abject and ignoble.

data.Sentence_cn: 克服怕死的最好办法，至少在我看来是这样，
data.Sentence: The best way to overcome it -- so at least it seems to me--

data.Sentence_cn: 就是逐渐使自己的兴趣更加广泛。
data.Sentence: is to make your interests gradually wider and more impersonal,

data.Sentence_cn: 逐渐摆脱个人狭小的圈子，直到自我的围墙一点一点地倒塌下来，
data.Sentence: until bit by bit the walls of the ego recede,

data.Sentence_cn: 自己的生活慢慢地和整个宇宙的生活融合在一起。
data.Sentence: and your life becomes increasingly merged in the universal life.

data.Sentence_cn: 个人的存在应该像一条河流，
data.Sentence: An individual human existence should be like a river--

data.Sentence_cn: 开始很小，被紧紧地夹在两岸中间，
data.Sentence: small at first, narrowly contained within its banks,

data.Sentence_cn: 接着热情奔放地冲过巨石，飞下瀑布。
data.Sentence: and rushing passionately past boulders and over waterfalls.

data.Sentence_cn: 然后河面渐渐地变宽，两岸后撤，河水流得平缓起来，
data.Sentence: Gradually the river grows wider, the banks recede, the waters flow more quietly,

data.Sentence_cn: 最后连绵不断地汇入大海，
data.Sentence: and in the end, without any visiblebreak, they become merged in the sea,

data.Sentence_cn: 毫无痛苦地失去了自我的存在。
data.Sentence: and painlessly lose their individual being.

data.Sentence_cn: 上了年纪的人这样看待生命，
data.Sentence: The man who, in old age can see his life in this way,

data.Sentence_cn: 就不会有惧怕死亡的心情了，
data.Sentence: will not suffer from the fear of death,

data.Sentence_cn: 因为自己关心的一切事件都会继续下去。
data.Sentence: since the things he cares for will continue.

data.Sentence_cn: 再者，随着精力的衰退，老年人的疲惫会增长，
data.Sentence: And if, with the decay of vitality, weariness increases,

data.Sentence_cn: 有长眠的愿望未尝不是一件好事情，
data.Sentence: the thought of rest will be not unwelcome.

data.Sentence_cn: 我希望工作到死为止，
data.Sentence: I should wish to die while still at work,

data.Sentence_cn: 明白了有人会继续我的未竟事业，
data.Sentence: knowing that others will carry on what I can no longer do,

data.Sentence_cn: 想到能做的事都做了，也就坦然了。
data.Sentence: and content in the thought that what was possible has been done.
